label: reservoirID
comment: The unique ID referring to the water reservoir corresponding to this observation.

label: reservoirName
comment: The name of the water reservoir corresponding to this observation.

label: riverBasin
comment: The name of the river/stream corresponding to this observation

label: fullReservoirLevel
comment: The maximum level the water in the reservoir is designed to reach.

label: totalReservoirCapacity
comment: Represents the total volume of water that the reservoir corresponding to this observation can hold.

label: currentReservoirCapacity
comment: The current volume of water stored in the reservoir corresponding to this observation.

label: waterLevel
comment: The water level in a specific water body such as the reservoir or the ground water table.

label: inflow
comment: Indicates the rate at which water enters into the reservoir corresponding to this observation.

label: outflow
comment: Indicates the rate at which water flows out of the reservoir corresponding to this observation.

label: nutrientInfo
comment: The chemical elements and compounds that are present in the entity corresponding to this observation.

label: th
comment: Total Hardness (TH) is the measurement of the mineral content in the water sample.

label: sar
comment: Sodium Adsorption Ratio (SAR) is the measure of water suitability for irrigation usage. The value represents the relative amount of Sodium ions to the combined amount of calcium and magnesium ions in water. It is calculated by the formula SAR = [Na]/(([Ca]+[Mg])/2)1/2.

label: rsc
comment: Residual Sodium Carbonate (RSC) Index is the measure of alkalinity hazard of irrigation water for soil.

label: location
comment: The location mapping the boundaries of the land parcel corresponding to the observation.

label: localeInfo
comment: Locale information corresponding to this observation.

label: season
comment: Represents specific time of the year that has distinct weather patterns and conditions, such as summer, autumn (fall), etc.

label: category
comment: Represents the name of classification of an entity or service based on a particular aspect.
